/>
VIII.iv.8.D.1.e
.
Control and Assignment of Definite Period of Schedular Temporary Total Evaluation
A definite temporary total evaluation period requires no future control.  If rated correctly, there is no potential for overpayment of the total disability period.  The rating that assigns the 100-percent evaluation also sets a subsequent evaluation to take effect after the specified period of total disability ends.
Reference
:  For information on control of indefinite periods of schedular temporary total evaluation, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 8.D.3
.
title: M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, Chapter 8, Section D - Other Temporary Total Evaluations
citation: Part VIII, Subpart iv, Chapter 8, Section D
